Hi Everyone, 

I am pleased to announce the opening of Picbreeder, a massiv=
e 
experiment in collaborative interactive evolution, which happens to 
be =
based on NEAT:

http://picbreeder.org

Picbreeder is a unique online servic=
e that allows users with no 
artistic experience to evolve pictures in coll=
aboration with each 
other. The technology behind Picbreeder is a novel NEA=
T-based Genetic 
Art applet that is integrated into a massive growing "tree=
 of life" 
that never ends. Anyone who evolves a picture they like can publ=
ish 
it to the world and thereby permanently add their creations to the 
ev=
er-expanding tree of life.

What makes Picbreeder particularly powerful and=
 unique is that you 
can *branch* from the published work of any other user=
 that has come 
before.  In other words, you do not have to begin from scra=
tch.  
Instead, for example, if you want to a evolve a face, you can branch=
 
from one of the many published faces and explore an infinite number 
of v=
ariations from that starting point.

Perhaps most intriguing is that we do =
not know what is possible to 
evolve.  As lineages are built upon lineages,=
 complexification in 
NEAT means that images can theoretically become more =
and more 
complex.  Thus, in theory, anything is possible.  In this sense 
=
Picbreeder's users are pioneers, exploring collectively a space that 
has n=
ever been exhaustively explored and discovering together 
creations that no=
 one of us could have discovered alone.

I hope that you will decide to joi=
n us on Picbreeder as we explore 
this space.

ken
